item.name: Energy, Climate and Grid Security Subcommittee

item.title: A bill to amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to establish a motor efficiency rebate program.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.name: Energy, Climate and Grid Security Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Environment.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text:
Amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to require the Secretary of Energy to establish a program to provide rebates for expenditures made by entities: (1) for the purchase and installation of a new electric motor that has a nominal full load efficiency that is not less than the nominal full load efficiency as defined in NEMA (National Electrical Manufacturers Association) Standards Publication MG 1-2006 for random wound motors rated 600 volts or lower or for form wound motors rated 5000 volts or lower; and (2) to replace an installed motor the specifications of which are to be established by the Secretary not later than 90 days after enactment of this Act.

Requires the Secretary to provide to the distributor of each such new electric motor purchased by an entity that received a rebate a payment to offset expenses relating to processing and motor core disposal costs.

bill.title: To amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to establish a motor efficiency rebate program.

item.title: To amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to establish a motor efficiency rebate program.
To amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to establish a motor efficiency rebate program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Environment.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
